bill_title: provide for the circumstances under which the state has jurisdiction over certain aircraft.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to provide for the circumstances under which the state has jurisdiction over certain aircraft. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. For the purposes of this Act, the phrase, an aircraft in flight, means an aircraft from the moment all external doors are closed following boarding through the moment when one external door is opened to allow passengers to leave the aircraft. However, if there is a forced landing, the phrase, an aircraft in flight, means an aircraft from the moment all external doors are closed following boarding until competent authorities take over responsibility for the aircraft and the individuals and property on the aircraft. Section 2. The aircraft jurisdiction of South Dakota includes any of the following aircraft in flight: (1) Any civil aircraft in South Dakota; (2) Any civil aircraft outside of South Dakota that has its next scheduled destination or last place of departure in South Dakota, if the aircraft next lands in South Dakota; (3) Any civil aircraft outside of South Dakota on which any person commits an offense, which if committed in the state would constitute a crime, if the aircraft lands in South Dakota with the person who committed the offense still on the aircraft; (4) Any civil aircraft outside of South Dakota against which any person commits an offense, as defined in subsection (d) or (e) of article I, section I of the Convention for the Suppression of Unlawful Acts against the Safety of Civil Aviation, if the aircraft lands in South Dakota with the person who committed the offense still on the aircraft; or (5) Any other civil aircraft leased without a crew to a lessee whose principal place of business is in South Dakota or, if the lessee does not have a principal place of business, whose permanent residence is in South Dakota.
